author: Peter Van der Linden
description: The tone and style of this text should make this a popular book with professional programmers. However, the tone of this book will make it very popular with undergraduates.

author: C. Publishing
description: The best way to learn C programming is by doing. This book includes a unique examples. Working through the examples will not only give you an immense sense of achievement, it will also help you retain the knowledge and master the language.

b_name: A Complete Guide to Programming in C++
author: Ulla Kirch-Prinz, Peter Prinz ·
description: This guide was written for readers interested in learning the C++ programming language from scratch, and for both novice and advanced C++ programmers wishing to enhance their knowledge of C++.

author: Richard Grimes ·
description: The main mission of this book is to make you familiar and comfortable with C++. You will finish the book not only being able to write your own code, but more importantly, you will be able to read other projects.

author: Bruce Eckel
description: Bruce Eckel 2003         Bruce Eckels-Thinking in Java— demonstrates advanced topics.Explains sound object-oriented principles as they apply to Java.Hands-on Java CD available online, with 15 hours of lectures and slides by Bruce Eckel.Live seminars, consulting

author: Mitsunori Ogihara
description: Meant to be used for a one-semester course to build solid foundations in Java, Fundamentals of Java Programming eschews second-semester content to concentrate on over 180 code examples and 250 exercises.

author: Anthony Adams
description: Hone your Python Programming skills and gain a sharp edge over other programmers the EASIEST way possible... with this practical beginner’s guide!

author: Michael Learn
description: Learn Python Programming In today's Industry, Python Programming is highly recommended for developing Websites.

author: Pat Morin
description: If you’re a student studying computer science or a software developer preparing for technical interviews, this practical book will help you learn and review some of the most important ideas in software engineering—data structures

b_name: An Introduction to Data Structures and Algorithms
author: John C. Cherniavsky,
description: The Handbook of Data Structures and Applications responds to the needs of students, professionals, and researchers who need a mainstream reference on data structures by providing a comprehensive survey of data structures of various types.

author: Frank M. Kromann
description: This edition of a classic best-seller includes detailed instructions for configuring the ultimate PHP 7 and MySQL development environment on all major platforms, complete coverage of the latest additions and improvements to the PHP language, and thorough introductions to MySQL’s most relied-upon features.

author: Bruce Herbert
description: PHP or PHP Hypertext Preprocessor is a programming language, which was designed with the objective to allow creation of dynamic content
